titan_pmr.purpose: Dispensing and workflow platform focused on safety, flow, accuracy and removing chaos from the bench.
titan_pmr.tone: Calm, precise, clinical leaning, grounded in operational reality, British English, no hype.
titan_pmr.emotional_mode: Calm confidence. Busy but never chaotic. The system has our back.
core_messages: AI filters risk first so pharmacists focus on what matters.
Barcode scanning checks every item for accuracy and patient safety.
Titan PMR supports NHS alignment through safe, regulated, auditable workflow.
The system lifts the load so pharmacists can lead.
prohibitions: Do not claim AI replaces pharmacists.
Do not say or imply Titan PMR does all the checking.
Do not suggest guaranteed zero errors or fully automated pharmacy.
Do not oversimplify Titan PMR checks; risk first filtering and barcode scanning must be explicit.

titanverse.purpose: Services operating system for NMS and private clinics that helps pharmacies build a service led, health hub model beyond dispensing.
titanverse.tone: Forward looking, opportunity driven, human, confident, lightly warm, no hype.
titanverse.emotional_mode: Constructive ambition. From items to clinics. There is a bigger model available if you choose to move.
core_messages: Dispensing alone will not pay the bills in the long term.
Private services are essential for a sustainable business model once NHS baselines are met.
Titanverse makes services easier to design, deliver, document and monetise.
NMS and IP clinics can be run through Titanverse; broader NHS services are not currently fully supported.
Service first workflow lets owners turn freed time into clinical and commercial value.
prohibitions: Do not imply Titanverse replaces NHS clinical systems or is an officially mandated NHS platform.
Do not describe Titanverse as a PMR or mix it with PMR safety messaging.
Do not promise Pharmacy First or other advanced NHS services as end to end supported.
Avoid heavy clinical overtones that belong to PMR; focus on clinics, patient experience and growth.

hard_separation_rules: Never merge Titan PMR and Titanverse into one product.
Always name Titan PMR for dispensing and workflow topics.
Always name Titanverse for services, clinics and patient experience topics.
Keep tone, purpose and messaging distinct at all times.
intersection_rules: When both products appear in one narrative, the sequence is: problem in dispensing -> Titan PMR removes chaos and frees time -> Titanverse turns that freed time into NHS and private services.
Do not say Titanverse solves dispensing problems.
Do not say Titan PMR runs clinics or services.

audience: Operational decision makers in UK community pharmacy

influences: Mehdi Hasan argument and pressure framing
Anne Lamott warmth and humanity (used sparingly)
style_rules: Write like a switched on human, not a corporate brand.
One clear idea per piece of content or slide.
Short sentences. Minimal jargon. If you must use jargon, explain it.

allowed: You may state uncomfortable truths about funding, workload and the limits of dispensing, as long as they are broadly accepted sector realities.
You may highlight the cost of inaction for owners: burnout, unsafe pressure, missed service income.
You may contrast old models (items only) with new models (services plus items) and make it clear the old model is not sustainable.
examples: Dispensing alone will not keep most pharmacies financially stable in the coming years.
If scripts remain your only serious income stream, the numbers will not add up.
You can wait for policy to save you or build a model that does not depend on it.
prohibitions: Do not attack individual pharmacists or staff.
Do not exaggerate crises or invent threats.
Do not use fear for its own sake; always pair tension with a credible path forward.

restrictions: Align with verified NHS strategy language only; do not invent future policy or funding.
Safety messaging must be specific: risk first filtering, pharmacist oversight, barcode checks on every item, patient mix up checks.
Do not generalise AI behaviour (avoid phrases like 'the AI does everything').
Do not misrepresent regulation, accreditation or what has been formally approved.

private_services.stance: Essential for sustainability beyond NHS thresholds once core NHS services are delivered.
private_services.tone: Pro private services, frank about NHS funding limits but respectful in language.

owner_mindset: Calm operations enable clinical and commercial growth.
Systems should remove pressure, not add to it.
Technology should reduce reliance on heroic effort.
The goal is to build a health hub, not just a dispensary.

preferred_explanation_structures: Solving a problem: problem -> why usual fixes fail -> what changes with Titan -> proof -> CTA.
Block by block: build understanding one foundation at a time.
Finish / start / finish: open with the outcome, rewind, walk back to the outcome with context.
